content: “Works” as in “it’s known that there is a stored energy which can be released under unbelievably extreme conditions.” “Just” as in “just achieving to maintain the conditions for the actual star reactions on the Earth, solving how anything involved in an experiment is not going to be destroyed so much that it’s not worth repeating the experiment, and while managing to extract the useful energy, all that sustainably.” Some problems simply don’t have solutions under the desired initial requirements. The only fusion power system that could be demonstrated to work using existing technology is exploding small hydrogen bombs underground! And even there the effective costs and the possible damages are problematic, the saner design would use “just” the less energetic fission bombs! We still don’t know if the only really sustainable harvesting of fusion energy is the one which the photosynthetic eukaryotes already do all over the Earth. It seems that even the nature needed a lot to achieve that — the photosynthetic cells are, as far as it’s presently known, billions of years more recent than the first life on Earth. Most of the energy we use today is obtained by burning the matter the plants produced by converting the energy from the Sun. The nature needed many millions of years for that, and it seems the humanity burned a half of conventional oil reserves in just a hundred years, while using the energy abundance to increase the population over the previous carrying capacities, effectively demanding always more energy. It should be researched, but at the moment the humanity should not plan its own future on the premise that producing fusion on Earth is a sustainable solution to the energy needs.
